required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Food Aversion in Patients With Anorexia Nervosa
clinical_study.official_title: Solving EPHX2 and Polyunsaturated Fatty Acid Interactions in Anorexia Nervosa

brief_summary.textblock: This study uses a meal-challenge protocol to assess if patients with anorexia nervosa show a differential meal-induced metabolism and response compared to healthy controls, and determines how genetic variation influence this difference.

detailed_description.textblock: Anorexia nervosa is a brain-based disorder that often leads to serious health consequences including death. The EPHX2 gene has been identified as a susceptibility gene for anorexia nervosa. With the application of complementary research approaches, this study aims to develop a multi-omics biomarker system for anorexia nervosa through a food-challenge protocol. The data will allow us to understand how disease susceptibility gene(s) contribute to food aversion, psychopathology, and outcome in patients with anorexia nervosa.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage change of food aversion/anxiety score

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage change in eating disorder psychopathology score

arm_group.description: All subjects will undergo the same food challenge protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ill AN subjects will meet current Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM V) diagnosis of restricting-type AN, body mass index (BMI) between11 kg/m2 and 17.5 kg/m2 .
- Recovered AN must meet the following criteria at time of study entry: 1) Past DSM V diagnosis of AN; 2) BMI between 18.5 kg/m2 and 30 kg/m2; 3) Having maintained a BMI of >18.5 for at least one year.
- Control must be healthy adolescent or woman negative on our screen for AN, other Axis I psychiatric illnesses, and having maintained a BMI of between18.5-30 since the age of 18.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion criteria for AN and control subjects includes: Organic brain syndrome, schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder, untreated thyroid disease, renal disease, hepatic disease, and the use of fish-oil containing supplements within the last three months of the study. All pregnant and lactating individuals will be excluded.

facility.name: Program for Eating Disorders, Toronto General Hospital

link.description: Program for Eating Disorders, Toronto General Hospital

reference.citation: Shih PB. Integrating multi-omics biomarkers and postprandial metabolism to develop personalized treatment for anorexia nervosa. Prostaglandins Other Lipid Mediat. 2017 Sep;132:69-76. doi: 10.1016/j.prostaglandins.2017.02.002. Epub 2017 Feb 21.
Shih PA, Woodside DB. Contemporary views on the genetics of anorexia nervosa. Eur Neuropsychopharmacol. 2016 Apr;26(4):663-73. doi: 10.1016/j.euroneuro.2016.02.008. Epub 2016 Feb 20. Review.

Shih PB, Yang J, Morisseau C, German JB, Zeeland AA, Armando AM, Quehenberger O, Bergen AW, Magistretti P, Berrettini W, Halmi KA, Schork N, Hammock BD, Kaye W. Dysregulation of soluble epoxide hydrolase and lipidomic profiles in anorexia nervosa. Mol Psychiatry. 2016 Apr;21(4):537-46. doi: 10.1038/mp.2015.26. Epub 2015 Mar 31.
